titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Harry Lee Cooper papers, 1931-1934
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Chiefly correspondence by family members to Cooper, who was a student at Duke University, Durham, N.C. during the Depression. Topics include health, family matters, and life in Nashville, N.C. Three other items include a program for the annual banquet of the Commercial Club of Durham High School, April 29, 1931; the 1931 official football schedule for N.C., S.C., Va., and the Southern Conference; and a final examination in Economics, May 25, 1932.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Harry Lee Cooper Papers, 1931-1934, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Harry Lee Cooper was a student at Duke University, Durham N.C.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Chiefly correspondence by family members to Cooper, who was a student at Duke University, Durham, N.C. during the Depression. Topics include health, family matters, and life in Nashville, N.C. Three other items include a program for the annual banquet of the Commercial Club of Durham High School, April 29, 1931; the 1931 official football schedule for N.C., S.C., Va., and the Southern Conference; and a final examination in Economics, May 25, 1932.

odd.p: Unprocessed collection. Cataloged from accession records.
